docs.snippet: Praise for U.S. Attorneys Dismissed by Justice Dept.  Internal Justice Department performance reports for six of the eight U.S. attorneys dismissed in recent months rated them ''well regarded'' or ''very competent.'' The evaluations, which were no...
docs.lead_paragraph: Praise for U.S. Attorneys Dismissed by Justice Dept. Internal Justice Department performance reports for six of the eight U.S. attorneys dismissed in recent months rated them ''well regarded'' or ''very competent.'' The evaluations, which were not made public before, raise questions about why the prosecutors were let go. PAGE 19 A Sorority Showdown Twenty-three women were asked to leave Delta Zeta sorority at DePauw University, including every member who was overweight or nonwhite. Others left in protest. PAGE 17 Venezuela a Top Arms Buyer Venezuelan arms spending has exceeded $4 billion in the past two years, putting the nation ahead of major buyers like Pakistan and Iran. Venezuela says the fighter jets, attack helicopters and Kalashnikovs are to counter potential aggression from the United States. PAGE 3 T: Women's Fashion The New York Times Style Magazine details the trends for spring, from a new fascination with the future to graphic prints and ethnic influences. Also: Cathy Horyn goes behind the scenes at Yves Saint Laurent. Review of Judge's Cases In an unusual move, a federal appeals court is recommending that an appeals board review immigration cases involving a New York judge whose asylum hearings have been criticized. PAGE 25 Finance Chief for Citigroup Citigroup is expected to name a top officer of American Express as its new chief financial officer in a move aimed at ending weeks of top management turmoil. PAGE 27 Opinion: Death by Pregnancy Nicholas D. Kristof, from Ethiopia, on what happens when the U.S. cuts aid to women in the developing world. WEEK IN REVIEW, PAGE 15 All Access, No Insight The Carpetbagger looks back on his humbling Oscar season on the edge of celebrity. ARTS & LEISURE

docs.snippet: Glamour Curls     ''I wanted something that was extremely masculine and extremely feminine,'' says the extremely talented Luigi Murenu of the Shirley Temple-meets-Dianne Brill updo that he did at Yves Saint Laurent. As befits a hairstyle honoring ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Glamour Curls ''I wanted something that was extremely masculine and extremely feminine,'' says the extremely talented Luigi Murenu of the Shirley Temple-meets-Dianne Brill updo that he did at Yves Saint Laurent. As befits a hairstyle honoring Brill, a woman who famously takes six hours to dress, it's quite a job to make, but the results -- 1940s glamour and '80s edge -- are très chic: just work a handful of Kérastase Mousse Nutri-Sculpt throughout the hair and blow-dry. Then use a 1 1/2-inch barreled curling iron to create voluptuous curls from root to tip. With a big paddle brush (Sephora has a good one), sweep the sides up into a chignon, leaving the top loose, and secure with heavy-duty bobby pins. Murenu uses a touch of serum (try John Frieda Frizz-Ease) at the sides. For a hard, punky finish, use a little gel (like Oscar Blandi Acqua Marina) to artfully muss your curls.

docs.snippet: The gold-plated Oscar, depicting a toned knight holding a crusader's sword, awards greatness in filmmaking. The gold-plated Hoscar, depicting a toned traveler holding a plaque, awards greatness in hostelry. This year's Hoscar ceremony, sponsored b...
docs.lead_paragraph: The gold-plated Oscar, depicting a toned knight holding a crusader's sword, awards greatness in filmmaking. The gold-plated Hoscar, depicting a toned traveler holding a plaque, awards greatness in hostelry. This year's Hoscar ceremony, sponsored by www.hostelworld.com, recently took place in Dublin. Some 500,000 online voters named the Jetpak City Hostel in Berlin ''Best Hostel of 2006.'' Runners-up included the Hostel of the Sun in Naples, Italy, and La Chimba in Santiago, Chile. In another online competition, the 2006 TripAdvisor Travelers' Choice Awards, it was the Hilton Maldives Resort and Spa Rangali Island that took top honors in the category of ''Best Luxury Hotel in the World.'' Perhaps it was Ithaa, the world's first undersea restaurant, below, that helped the resort clinch the title. From July 15 to 28, Sierra Club Outings will sponsor the first public trip through Cordillera Azul National Park in central Peru, which was created by the government in 2001 after 28 never-before-seen species of plants and animals were discovered in a remote area between the Huallaga and Ucayali rivers. The cost for the trip, which includes canoeing, backpacking and helicopter transfers to and from the park, is $3,395. The second trip is planned for Oct. 1 to 14 (sierraclub.org/outings/national). EasyHotel, a budget hotel chain, is scheduled to open a property in Luton, England -- about three miles from the London Luton Airport -- by the end of the year. Prices will start at around 25 pounds, or $49.75 at $1.99 to the pound, and reservations will be available on www.easyHotel.com later this year. Through May 6, Budget Rent A Car customers who reserve a car for four or more consecutive days that include a Sunday will receive the Sunday rental for free (www.budget.com/freesunday; coupon number TUNZ001 must be mentioned). HILARY HOWARD
